title: Bitcoin Price Hits All-Time High Above $19,000, Topping 2017 Record
sub_head: Digital currencyâ€™s rise is driven by wave of new investors seeking big gains
body:
Bitcoin surged Monday to set its first fresh record in nearly three years, driven by a wave of new investors lured by the potential for big profits.
The digital currency rose as high as $19,786.24, up 8.4% on the day. That topped the previous intraday record of $19,783.21 set Dec. 18, 2017, according to CoinDesk. Bitcoin has nearly tripled in 2020 and is up 97% since early September. Most recently, it traded around $19,200.
The...
